author: funnygiulio
content: hello, after PoS there wont be any reorgs longer than Epoch right?

author: funnygiulio
content: after finality we cannot reorg past the finality point? is that correct?

author: daniellehrner
content:
Under normal circumstances, no. But Ethereum could be attacked / suffer a major bug and it could be necessary to do an emergency reorg past finalized blocks. 

There was an discussion going on a while ago. In Besu we have afterwards allowed to do reorgs past finalized blocks: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/974664364466511972/974671778439921664

author: funnygiulio
content: okay, but if we a running a client, we cant get past that point without restarting it

author: funnygiulio
content: CL wont instruct us to reorg in the previous epoch

author: m.kalinin
content: Re-orgs longer than epoch are still possible though impractical on a healthy network. Past finality reorgs should be supported by ELs, and it's not necessarily requires EL client to be restarted
